headers.subject: [tosdr:1716] [Info] Spotify uses a third party to process payments

html:
Spotify uses a third party to process payments, although they do not specify who. However, the privacy policy does specify the limited information that is provided to Spotify from this third party (e.g., card type, expiration date, last four digits).

When you sign up for a Trial or any of our Paid Subscriptions (as defined in the Terms and Conditions of Use), or make other purchases through the Service, your credit card information and other financial data that we need to process your payment are collected and stored by third party payment processors. We may collect some limited information, such as your postal code, mobile number and details of your transaction history. In addition, the third party payment processors generally provide us with some limited information related to you, such as a unique token that enables you to make additional purchases using the information they’ve stored, and your card’s type, expiration date, and last four digits. If you choose to pay by invoice, Spotify may need to collect and transfer additional information, like your name, date of birth and phone number, to our invoicing service provider to enable credit checks and send you invoices. The use of your data by our invoicing service provider is subject to its privacy policies.

https://www.spotify.com/us/legal/privacy-policy/ 

--
tosdr.org | twitter.com/tosdr | github.com/tosdr

subject: [Info] Spotify uses a third party to process payments
text:
Spotify uses a third party to process payments, although they do not 
specify who. However, the privacy policy does specify the limited 
information that is provided to Spotify from this third party (e.g., card 
type, expiration date, last four digits).

When you sign up for a Trial or any of our Paid Subscriptions (as defined 
> in the Terms and Conditions of Use<https://www.spotify.com/us/legal/end-user-agreement/>), 
> or make other purchases through the Service, your credit card information 
> and other financial data that we need to process your payment are collected 
> and stored by third party payment processors. We may collect some limited 
> information, such as your postal code, mobile number and details of your 
> transaction history. In addition, the third party payment processors 
> generally provide us with some limited information related to you, such as 
> a unique token that enables you to make additional purchases using the 
> information they’ve stored, and your card’s type, expiration date, and last 
> four digits. If you choose to pay by invoice, Spotify may need to collect 
> and transfer additional information, like your name, date of birth and 
> phone number, to our invoicing service provider to enable credit checks and 
> send you invoices. The use of your data by our invoicing service provider 
> is subject to its privacy policies.


https://www.spotify.com/us/legal/privacy-policy/ 

-- 
tosdr.org | twitter.com/tosdr | github.com/tosdr
